comments.author: Sariel V.7024
comments.body:
Lawton Campbell.8517:

Oops, those extra added achievements were a fat-finger on my part. They’re all stuff that was cut or not released or unfinished, including that “Treasure Hunter” achievement (there’s another one with the same name in the rare collections category).

That recalls the Hero of the People collection, which was “made” around the same time…

comments.author: Anhim.3156
comments.body: Alright, thanks for the quick reply. I had assumed something like this due to the low id number and never before seen descriptions :p

comments.author: Lawton Campbell.8517
comments.body:
Oops, those extra added achievements were a fat-finger on my part. They’re all stuff that was cut or not released or unfinished, including that “Treasure Hunter” achievement (there’s another one with the same name in the rare collections category).

I’ve taken the liberty of un-whitelisting them, sorry about that.

comments.author: Anhim.3156
comments.body:
I get the impression that there was some sort of update with the achievements on Monday as a quite a few ‘new’ ones appeared on my end. That said, it seems like they did not get added into their respective categories.

A quick example:
Treasure hunter: https://api.guildwars2.com/v2/achievements/109
This is a ‘Rare collection’ and has such should belong in: https://api.guildwars2.com/v2/achievements/categories/75, but the ID seems to be missing from here.

This seems to repeat for quite a few of these ‘new’ achievements. Now maybe this is a problem on my end, but I don’t believe so.

p.s: Does this mean there are already plans for another ~7 years
